column4: let's say I messed up really bad with the purge command, and I don't even have a terminal, how can I backup some files before freshinstalling?
what did you purge?
can you ctrl+alt+f1 into another terminal?
if you can get there you can try running apt-get install ubuntu-desktop
sorry I was writting to the wrong person, thanks I wasn't even remembering that
is there anything like an history for packages removed where I could just undo this mess?
I've never really run into something like that, but ubuntu-desktop is a metapackage that holds most of the core Desktop experience
I've sure lost that, every windows looks win95 now, and every application I close disappears(deluge, chrome, terminal, vlc, all gone now)
haha, that'll happen. Do you remember what you purged?
yeah, sounds like you broke some desktop dependency with purge
it sounds like you lost mostly GTK packages. Were you able to get into another terminal via CTRL+ALT+F1?
i did "sudo apt-get purge wine*" and I only noticed I'd done crap when I saw terminal output "Removing google-chrome-stable"
you should definitely give installing ubuntu-desktop a shot
werd, good luck man. I hope you've learned your lesson about package managing while high ;P
all I wanted was this crappy japanese game working, windows binaries so I needed a specific wine version for it xD
did you grab Crossover while it was free this week?
had no idea :(
for newer windows apps, (Skyrim, MS Office 2010) it is definitely worth it
if the software is from before 2005, you're better off with stock WINE
still all the games that I used to play one wine 1.2.2 dont work on the newer versions of wine
do you know if you're running 64/32?
64bits
